data.title: A Jarring Comparison That Shows You Just How Much Older Rasheed Wallace Makes The Knicks
data.text:
This story is available exclusively to Business Insider subscribers. Become an Insider and start reading now. Have an account? .

Rasheed Wallace officially signed with the Knicks today.

With the addition, the Knicks become the oldest team in NBA history, according to the WSJ.

Advertisement

Even though he's 38, Wallace is just the fourth-oldest player on the team behind Jason Kidd, Kurt Thomas, and Marcus Camby.

We took a look at the fourth-oldest players on every other NBA team, and found that no team even comes close to having the age (experience?) that the Knicks have. Rasheed is five years older than any "fourth-oldest player" on any other NBA team. He's 8 years older than the median age for "fourth-oldest" guys around the league.

This story is available exclusively to Business Insider subscribers. Become an Insider and start reading now. Have an account? .

In short: No other team in the NBA has multiple players that are that old.

Here's the list of "fourth-oldest" guys for all 30 teams:

Advertisement

Rasheed Wallace, New York Knicks (38)

Jason Collins, Boston Celtics (33)

Elton Brand, Dallas Mavericks (33)

Jamal Crawford, Los Angeles Clippers (32)

Advertisement

Metta World Peace, Los Angeles Lakers (32)

Mike Miller, Miami Heat (32)

Vladimir Radmonovic, Chicago Bulls (31)

Jason Richardson, Philadelphia 76ers (31)

Advertisement

Drew Gooden, Milwaukee Bucks (31)

Gerald Wallace, Brooklyn Nets (30)

Tony Allen, Memphis Grizzlies (30)

Jameer Nelson, Orlando Magic (30)

Advertisement

Nene, Washington Wizards (30)

Devin Harris, Atlanta Hawks (29)

Ben Gordon, Charlotte Bobcats (29)

Ike Diougu, Phoenix Suns (29)

Advertisement

Mo Williams, Utah Jazz (29)

Jarrett Jack, Golden State Warriors (28)

Travis Outlaw, Sacramento Kings (28)

Shaun Livingston, Houston Rockets (27)

Advertisement

Sam Young, Indiana Pacers (27)

Darryl Watkins, New Orleans Hornets (27)

Kendrick Perkins, Oklahoma City Thunder (27)

LaMarcus Aldridge, Portland Trailblazers (27)

Advertisement

Linas Kleiza, Toronto Raptors (27)

Jeremy Pargo, Cleveland Cavaliers (26)

Corey Brewer, Denver Nuggets (26)
